name: Grilled Chicken, Tomato and Baby Greens Salad with Blue Cheese
description: Grilled chicken is sliced and tossed with fresh salad greens, tomatoes, bacon bits and blue cheese, then dressed with creamy blue cheese dressing.
recipeIngredient: ¾ pound boneless, skinless chicken breast halves
Salt and ground black pepper, to taste
1 (7.75 ounce) package DOLE® Extra Veggie™ with Grape Tomatoes
2 slices bacon, cooked, drained and crumbled
Bottled blue cheese dressing, to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Brush chicken with oil; season with salt and pepper, to taste.  Grill 8 to 12 minutes or until no longer pink in the center (165 degrees F), turning once.  Cool chicken enough to handle; slice into thin strips.
Combine salad blend, tomatoes from pouch, cooked sliced chicken, avocado, bacon, egg and blue cheese in large bowl.  Toss with blue cheese dressing, to taste.

aggregateRating.itemReviewed: Grilled Chicken, Tomato and Baby Greens Salad with Blue Cheese

review.reviewBody: Hubs SAID he liked his salad but frankly it sounded weak. But then again he didn t top his with the blue cheese dressing because he doesn't care for it. He used Hidden Valley Ranch. He skipped the avocado because he hates it. And he without any deliberation chose to exclude the crumbled blue cheese because you got it he hates it. He has no idea what he was missing. Who wants a salad that s just all right? First right off the bat I made my own blue cheese dressing rather than using some inferior bottled stuff. I made a small batch of Absolutely the BEST Rich and Creamy Blue Cheese Dressing Ever! also on AR and it was so good it probably would have made ANY green salad better. I used a creamy Gorgonzola an Italian blue cheese. I used red-ripe Roma (plum) tomatoes and a good amount of bacon which of course remember more is always better. As for the chicken I didn t bother to grill it when I had perfectly cooked rotisserie chicken breast to slice up. A simple and simply delicious salad easy to throw together particularly if you make a good blue cheese dressing ahead of time and take the short cut of a rotisserie chicken.

Great salad but an absolute MUST is making your own dressing. Not to have freshly made blue cheese dressing would be a sin. Use "Absolutely the BEST Rich and Creamy Blue Cheese Dressing Ever!" recipe found on AR. Your family and guest will rave about this salad.

Nice take on a classic cobb salad! This was a great way to use up some leftover grilled chicken I had on hand. I did up the amount of bacon - who doesn't love bacon right? And I added an additional hard boiled egg. Like others I opted to make my own blue cheese dressing and my favorite by far is "Absolutely the BEST Rich and Creamy Blue Cheese dressing" from this site and the title is very fitting. Since my husband is a die hard ranch dressing fan I opted to use "Chef John's Ranch Dressing" - also from this site. This made for a great throw together weeknight meal that turned out fabulous. Great served with warm crusty bread.

This was just not good. Way too much blue cheese. I LOVE blue cheese but blue cheese in the dressing and more blue cheese in the salad overpowered everything else. If I were to make this again using my own tweaks I'd leave the blue cheese out of the salad and rely on the dressing to provide that element. I did make the AR Blue cheese dressing too btw. The chicken was great.
I added some broccoli and mushrooms with this summertime salad. Nothing like blue cheese dressing on a chicken salad.
Quick and easy dinner with leftover chicken as well.
Followed it to a T! Delicious!
